I've read the Scoop essay at George's link. I found the thesis plausible, well referenced, and well written.
 
 I've snipped the following bit because I don't believe this claim:
 
 Recent research has shown that the Bush administration was deeply implicated not merely in permitting the attacks of September 11, 2001 to happen, but in actually organizing them. 
 
 That's an allegation too far for me.
 
 
 The rest of a long and complex argument seems to boil down to the following:

 2). If Iran abandons the petrodollar and sets up an oil bourse in euros, the American economy will suffer a crippling hit.
 
 3). For these reasons the United States, in partnership with Israel, intends to launch a pre-emptive strike against Iran. 
 
 4). This will take the form of an air attack using tactical nuclear weapons. 
 
 5). Turkey will be bribed by promises of US economic and technological assistance to allow the strike force to take off from its airfields.
 
 I've oversimplified, but these 5 points seem to summarise the plot.
 
 Should all this come to pass, a severe political and economic crisis affecting the entire world could rapidly transpire. What the Scoop article doesn't speculate about, are the likely attitudes of Russia and China (to these events) and a lot would depend on how they react.
